channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 2023 Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, February 26, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support 2023 Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month.

Each year in Australia around 1,720 women are diagnosed with ovarian cancer. In most cases the cancer will be diagnosed at an advanced stage, where it is very difficult to treat. That is why we're committed to ensuring that every Australian knows more about ovarian cancer and its early symptoms. We need your support to help us achieve this goal. Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month is held in Australia during February to educate, advocate and elevate awareness of ovarian cancer. Promote awareness by wearing a teal ribbon.

This light up is organised by: Queensland Health

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Rare Diseases Day
item.description:
Tuesday, February 28, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue Pink Green Purple to support Rare Diseases Day.

Rare Voices Australia (RVA) is the peak body for Australians living with a rare disease. RVA provides a strong, unified voice to advocate for policy as well as health, disability and other systems that work for people living with a rare disease. Rare Disease Day is the globally coordinated movement for rare diseases, working towards equity in social opportunity, healthcare, and access to diagnosis and therapies for people living with a rare disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Rare Voices Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Make March Purple
item.description:
Wednesday, March 1, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple.

Every 33 minutes a life is turned upside down by epilepsy Help turn things around - Make March Purple for epilepsy. Make March Purple is an Australia-wide campaign supported by epilepsy organisations across the country and the national peak body Epilepsy Australia. Purple Day, held on 26 March is an International Day of Awareness for people impacted by epilepsy. There are so many fun ways for Queenslanders to raise awareness and funds during March in support of people affected by epilepsy.

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of 2023 Red Bow Day
item.description:
Thursday, March 2, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and Purple to support Eve of 2023 Red Bow Day.

Muscular Dystrophy Queensland supports people living with muscle wasting conditions, so that they can make the most of opportunities and live the lives they choose. Red Bow Day is one of our most important appeals for raising awareness for and funds to support people living with muscle wasting conditions.

This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy QLD

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 World Hearing Day
item.description:
Friday, March 3, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support 2023 World Hearing Day.

Established in 1992, Hear and Say is a local Queensland charity and an expert in hearing technology and listening and spoken language therapy. We empower individuals with hearing loss to live life connected with their friends, family and community. Held annually on 3 March, World Hearing Day raises awareness for people who are deaf or hard of hearing, it also promotes the prevention of hearing loss.

This Light Up is organised by: Hear and Say Centre

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.description:
Saturday, March 4, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue and Yellow to celebrate the 2023 Marist College Ashgrove Formal.

2023 Marist College Ashgrove Formal is being held in City Hall.  

This Light Up is organised by: Marist College Ashgrove

item.title: Dolphins 2023 Inaugural Season Match
item.description:
Sunday, March 5, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Dolphins 2023 Inaugural Season Match.

The Dolphins is Brisbane's newest NRL team and will be celebrating its inaugural season match on March 5, 2023. This will be thier first ever game as a NRL team, playing at Suncorp Stadium where they will also pay tribute to the first ever Indigenous sports captain in Australia, Arthur Beetson who was a Dolphins legend.

This Light Up is organised by: Dolphins NRL

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Lymphoedema Day
item.description:
Monday, March 6, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support World Lymphoedema Day.

Lymphoedema Association Australias (LAA) vision is for a world in which people who live with Lymphoedema are always met with understanding by the communnity and health systems. World Lymphoedma Awareness day 6th March and the month of March are used to raise awareness of the chronic condition of lymphoedma and to support those living with this condition. The LAA (previously LAQ) works towards this through education, advocating for and supporting those living with lymphedema.

This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoedema Association of Australia

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support World Lymphoedema Day.
Lymphoedema Association Australias (LAA) vision is for a world in which people who live with Lymphoedema are always met with understanding by the communnity and health systems. World Lymphoedma Awareness day 6th March and the month of March are used to raise awareness of the chronic condition of lymphoedma and to support those living with this condition. The LAA (previously LAQ) works towards this through education, advocating for and supporting those living with lymphedema.

item.title: Queensland Women's Week
item.description:
Tuesday, March 7, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Queensland Women's Week.

Queensland Women's Week (QWW) recognises and celebrates the successes and achievements of women and girls across Queensland. It’s a time to acknowledge that everyone has a role to play in creating a Queensland community that respects women, embraces gender equality, and promotes and protects the rights, interests and wellbeing of women and girls. By doing this, we enrich and strengthen our communities and create a more equal Queensland where everyone is valued.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Justice and Attorney General

item.title: Delivering Hope - 3rd Anniversary of 4Voices
item.description:
Friday, March 10, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Delivering Hope - 3rd Anniversary of 4Voices.

4 Voices aims to connect vulnerable women and girls who suffer from social isolation, domestic violence, and homeless to name a few, through an outreach service, to ensure they are connected and have access to services that they may not have due to these circumstances.

This Light Up is organised by: 4 Voices

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Irish Festival and St Patrick's Day Parade
item.description:
Saturday, March 11, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate the Brisbane Irish Festival and St Patrick's Day Parade.

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.
This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

item.title: International Women's Day Fun Run
item.description:
Sunday, March 12, 2023

City Hall will be lit Pink to support International Women's Day Fun Run.

Mater Foundation - supporting compassionate care for our community by raising funds for healthcare and medical research programs at Mater. The annual RACQ International Women's Day Fun Run campaigns will be helping to fund life-saving research at Mater to better understand and treat breast cancer now and into the future.

This Light Up is organised by: Mater Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Endometriosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, March 13, 2023

City Hall will be lit Yellow to support Endometriosis Awareness Month.

Endometriosis Australia endeavours to increase recognition of endometriosis, provide endometriosis education programs, and help fund endometriosis research. The annual Endo Enlightened campaign aims to raise awareness of endometriosis and provides a demonstration of hope and support for the 1 in 9 women and those who identify as gender diverse affected by the disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Endometriosis Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Cycling Festival
item.description:
Wednesday, March 15, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue, Pink, Green and Purple to celebrate Brisbane Cycling Festival.

The Brisbane Cycling Festival will return from March 15th to April 16th 2023. From the elite right through to mass participation events there is something for every cyclist of all abilities. The citywide celebration of cycling will come together again at Brisbane Showgrounds with a free pop-up Festival Village welcoming riders and spectators alike.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane French Film Festival
item.description:
Wednesday, March 15, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Brisbane French Film Festival.

Established in 1907, the Alliance Française de Brisbane has always acted as a connector between the France and Queensland. For 115 years, as a local not-for-profit organisation, it has served as a place where language and culture were shared, including The Alliance Française French Film Festival.

This is the largest foreign film festival in Queensland with: over 17,000 spectators, 40 films over 460 screenings, and Master classes and panel discussions with industry professionals.

This Light Up is organised by: Alliance Francaise de Brisbane

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: St Patricks Day
item.description:
Thursday, March 16, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to celebrate St Patricks Day.

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Saturday, March 18, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to celebrate Brisbane Cycling Festival.

The Brisbane Cycling Festival will return from March 15th to April 16th 2023. From the elite right through to mass participation events there is something for every cyclist of all abilities. item.title: Dance for Daniel
item.description:
Saturday, March 18, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to support Dance for Daniel.

City Hall will be lit Red for the Daniel Morcombe Foundation event ‘Dance for Daniel’. The Dance for Daniel is the Daniel Morcombe Foundation's key fundraising event and is a night of celebration of the achievements of the Foundation and the wider child safety sector. The 2023 event marks the 18th Annual Dance. The night represents a gathering of supporters, corporate partners, VIPs and Foundation committee.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morecombe Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Coeliac Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, March 19, 2023

The Tropical Domewill be lit Green to support Coeliac Awareness Week.

Coeliac Australia wishes to light up landmarks for Coeliac Awareness week 2023. Currently 80% of people with coeliac disease remain undiagnosed and the aim of our campaign is to increase awareness within the community to drive higher diagnosis rates. Coeliac Australia is a registered charity that supports Australians with coeliac disease and associated conditions requiring a gluten free diet. We provide a range of support and information services to enhance the lives of people with coeliac disease, raise vital funds for research and create awareness of coeliac disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Coeliac Australia

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: 2023 Track National Championships
item.description:
Monday, March 20, 2023

City Hall will be lit Green and Gold to support 2023 Track National Championships.

The Track National Championships are the biggest domestic track event in the country, and will see the Anna Meares Velodrome, Brisbane hosting #TrackNats22 - Featuring Australia’s best in the Elite, Para-cycling, Under 19, Under 17 and Masters categories. National champions will be crowned in the individual and team sprint, keirin, individual and team pursuits, individual time trials, points race and scratch race, omnium and Madison events held during March and April.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Harmony Day
item.description:
Tuesday, March 21, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Harmony Day.

Harmony Day is celebrated annually on March 21st in Australia. Harmony Day began in 1999, coinciding with the United Nations International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination. Each year, it is marked by people coming together and participating in local activities. The continuing message of Harmony Day is 'Everyone Belongs'. It is about community participation, inclusiveness, celebrating diversity, respect and belonging. The national colour for harmony day is Orange.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: World Science Festival and CurioCity
item.description:
Wednesday, March 22, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to celebrate World Science Festival and CurioCity.

Queensland Museum Network will once again be hosting World Science Festival which this year will also include Curiocity. The only global extension of this hugely popular initiative, World Science Festival Brisbane reinforces Queensland Museum’s position as a leader in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education and engagement. World Science Festival Brisbane celebrates the entanglement of science and art through a curated program of thought-provoking conversations, inspiring theatrical and cinematic experiences, interactive workshops and engaging demonstrations. Curiocity Brisbane sparks inspiration and innovation, transforming our city into an interactive place to 'explore, create and play'. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like support the joint event through activating red city lighting across Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate World Science Festival and CurioCity.

Queensland Museum Network will once again be hosting World Science Festival which this year will also include Curiocity. The only global extension of this hugely popular initiative, World Science Festival Brisbane reinforces Queensland Museum’s position as a leader in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education and engagement. World Science Festival Brisbane celebrates the entanglement of science and art through a curated program of thought-provoking conversations, inspiring theatrical and cinematic experiences, interactive workshops and engaging demonstrations. Curiocity Brisbane sparks inspiration and innovation, transforming our city into an interactive place to 'explore, create and play'. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like support the joint event through activating red city lighting across Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 Pakistan National Day
item.description:
Thursday, March 23, 2023

City Hall will be lit White and Green to recognise 2023 Pakistan National Day.

Pakistan National Day is celebrated on 23 March and this light up aims to uplift the Pakistani Australian Community's recognition and community efforts in beautiful multi-cultural Queensland.  

This Light Up is organised by: Pakistan Australian Cultural Association

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
